AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alpine, Texas: location where Border Patrol Agents were stationed, area of patrol for Agent Andrew P. Graham
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican border: border area being patrolled by Border Patrol Agents, including the Big Bend National Park, with vehicle sensors located within 50 miles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend National Park: part of the area being patrolled by Border Patrol Agents, included in the 140-mile area of the United States/Mexican border, where vehicle sensors detected northbound vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marfa Sector Area Operations Center: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass, prior to transfer to Alpine, Texas, whose Communications notified the agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass, border area patrolled before transfer to Alpine, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: state where smuggling activities are taking place, including areas along the United States/Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Highway 385: highway notorious for smuggling, with increased alien and narcotics apprehensions in recent months
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mississippi: state of origin for a vehicle's license plate, associated with a vehicle carrying an older Anglo couple and bearing a park registration receipt
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Kansas: state associated with a vehicle's license plate, destination of smuggled narcotics
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marathon, Texas: location where the truck drove through at 20 miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 90: road with a posted speed limit of 20 miles per hour, road where the truck turned left after stopping at a stop sign in Marathon, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fort Stockton: destination for most vehicles coming up Highway 385, not taken by the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 10: highway toward which most vehicles would continue from Highway 385, not taken by the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 118: most direct and logical route of travel from Big Bend to Alpine, not taken by the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that denied Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot's motion to suppress evidence and sentenced him to 46 months' imprisonment, court considering the totality of the driver's behavior in determining reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country sharing a border with Mexico, country where this circuit is located
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 385: location where Agents Graham and Snodgrass were parked, approximately 75 miles north of the United States/Mexican border
